keyTakeAways: A road crash on the Kampala-Gulu Highway in Uganda resulted in 46 fatalities, after an initial reported toll of 63 was revised downward.
The crash involved two buses traveling in opposite directions attempting to overtake a lorry and a car, leading to a head-on and side collision and a chain reaction of vehicle overthrows.
One of the buses swerved to avoid a collision, which caused a cascading crash involving multiple vehicles.

The incident prompted a government response, with President Yoweri Museveni expressing sorrow and directing financial aid: 5 million shillings ($1,430) per bereaved family and 1 million shillings to injured individuals.
The Kampala-Gulu Highway is one of Uganda's busiest roads and a high-risk area for traffic-related incidents.
Police cited dangerous and careless overtaking as a leading cause of crashes in the country and urged drivers to exercise caution.
An official investigation has been launched to determine the root cause of the accident.
Injured passengers were transported to hospitals in Kiryandongo, a western town in Uganda.
The police initially included unconscious victims in the death toll, which was later corrected, highlighting challenges in accurate casualty reporting after mass accidents.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A fatal road crash occurred on the Kampala-Gulu Highway in Uganda at 00:15 local time (21:15 GMT), where two buses traveling in opposite directions attempted to overtake a lorry and car, resulting in a head-on and side collision and a chain reaction of vehicle overthrows. The incident ultimately caused 46 deaths, after an initial count of 63 was revised down due to inclusion of unconscious victims. The Uganda Police Force confirmed the deaths, launched an investigation, and urged caution against dangerous overtaking, which they identify as a leading cause of crashes. President Yoweri Museveni expressed sorrow, sent condolences, and ordered financial compensation: 5 million shillings per bereaved family and 1 million shillings to injured individuals. Injured victims were taken to hospitals in Kiryandongo, and ongoing efforts focus on determining the root cause of the accident and improving road safety across one of Ugandaâ€™s busiest highways.
